qas.question: How many states does Nigeria have?
What non-state area does Nigeria have?
How many smaller areas are the Nigerian states divided into?
What are the Nigerian states' sub-divisions called?
How many geopolitical zones do people consider the Nigerian states to be in?

context: Nigeria is divided into <a0_0>thirty-six<a0_0/> states and one <a1_0>Federal Capital Territory<a1_0/>, which are further sub-divided into <a2_0>774<a2_0/> <a3_0>Local Government Areas<a3_0/> (LGAs). The plethora of states, of which there were only three at independence, reflect the country's tumultuous history and the difficulties of managing such a heterogeneous national entity at all levels of government. In some contexts, the states are aggregated into <a4_0>six<a4_0/> geopolitical zones: North West, North East, North Central, South East, South South, and South West.
